title: Entanglement theory and the second law of thermodynamics
title_cn: 纠缠理论与热力学第二定律
abstract: Entanglement is central both to the foundations of quantum theory and, as a novel resource, to quantum information science. The theory of entanglement establishes basic laws that govern its manipulation, in particular the non-increase of entanglement under local operations on the constituent particles. Such laws aim to draw from them formal analogies to the second law of thermodynamics; however, whereas in the second law the entropy uniquely determines whether a state is adiabatically accessible from another, the manipulation of entanglement under local operations exhibits a fundamental irreversibility, which prevents the existence of such an order. Here, we show that a reversible theory of entanglement and a rigorous relationship with thermodynamics may be established when considering all non-entangling transformations. The role of the entropy in the second law is taken by the asymptotic relative entropy of entanglement in the basic law of entanglement. We show the usefulness of this approach to general resource theories and to quantum information theory.
abstract_cn: 纠缠对于量子理论的基础以及作为一种新型资源的量子信息科学都是至关重要的。纠缠理论建立了控制其操纵的​​基本定律，尤其是在对组成粒子的局部操作下纠缠的不增加。这些定律的目的是从形式上类似于热力学第二定律。然而，尽管在第二定律中，熵唯一地确定了一个状态是否可以从另一个状态绝热地访问，但是在局部操作下对纠缠的操纵表现出基本的不可逆性，这阻止了这种顺序的存在。在这里，我们表明，当考虑所有非纠缠转换时，可以建立可逆的纠缠理论以及与热力学的严格关系。熵在第二定律中的作用由纠缠基本定律中的渐近相对熵表示。我们展示了这种方法对一般资源理论和量子信息理论的有用性。

title: Quantum states and phases in driven open quantum systems with cold atoms
title_cn: 带冷原子的驱动开放量子系统中的量子态和相
abstract: An open quantum system, the time evolution of which is governed by a master equation, can be driven into a given pure quantum state by an appropriate design of the coupling between the system and the reservoir. This provides a route towards preparing many-body states and non-equilibrium quantum phases by quantum-reservoir engineering. Here, we discuss the example of a driven dissipative Bose–Einstein condensate of bosons and of paired fermions, where atoms in an optical lattice are coupled to a bath of Bogoliubov excitations and the atomic current represents local dissipation. In the absence of interactions, the lattice gas is driven into a pure state with long-range order. Weak interactions lead to a weakly mixed state, which in three dimensions can be understood as a depletion of the condensate, and in one and two dimensions exhibits properties reminiscent of a Luttinger liquid or a Kosterlitz–Thouless critical phase at finite temperature, with the role of the ‘finite temperature’ taken by the interactions.
abstract_cn: 一个开放的量子系统，其时间演化由一个主方程控制，可以通过适当设计该系统与储层之间的耦合，将其驱动为给定的纯量子态。这为通过量子储库工程制备多体态和非平衡量子相提供了一条途径。在这里，我们讨论玻色子和成对的费米子的驱散型Bose爱因斯坦凝聚物的例子，其中光学晶格中的原子与Bogoliubov激发浴耦合，原子电流表示局部耗散。在没有相互作用的情况下，晶格气被驱使成具有长程有序的纯态。弱相互作用导致弱混合状态，在三个维度上可以将其理解为冷凝物的消耗，而在一个和两个维度上则表现出让人联想到Luttinger液体或Kosterlitz极限温度下的临界相的特性。有限温度的作用被互动所吸引。

title: Crystallization of strongly interacting photons in a nonlinear optical fibre
title_cn: 非线性光纤中强相互作用光子的结晶
abstract: Understanding strongly correlated quantum systems is a central problem in many areas of physics. The collective behaviour of interacting particles gives rise to diverse fundamental phenomena such as confinement in quantum chromodynamics, electron fractionalization in the quantum Hall regime and phase transitions in unconventional superconductors and quantum magnets. Such systems typically involve massive particles, but optical photons can also interact with one another in a nonlinear medium. In practice, however, such interactions are often very weak. Here we describe a technique that enables the creation of a strongly correlated quantum gas of photons using one-dimensional optical systems with tight field confinement and coherent photon trapping techniques. The confinement enables the generation of large, tunable optical nonlinearities via the interaction of photons with a nearby cold atomic gas. In its extreme, we show that a quantum light field can undergo fermionization in such one-dimensional media, which can be probed via standard photon correlation measurements.
abstract_cn: 了解强相关的量子系统是许多物理领域的中心问题。相互作用粒子的集体行为引起了各种基本现象，例如量子色动力学的局限，量子霍尔态的电子分级以及非常规超导体和量子磁体的相变。这样的系统通常包含大量粒子，但是光学光子也可以在非线性介质中相互影响。然而，实际上，这种相互作用通常非常弱。在这里，我们描述了一种技术，该技术能够使用具有严格场限制和相干光子捕获技术的一维光学系统创建光子的强相关量子气体。该限制使得能够通过光子与附近的冷原子气体的相互作用来产生较大的可调谐光学非线性。在极端情况下，我们证明了量子光场可以在这种一维介质中发生费米离子化，可以通过标准的光子相关性测量对其进行探测。

title: A giant electro-optic effect using polarizable dark states
title_cn: 使用可极化的暗态的巨大电光效应
abstract: The electro-optic effect, where the refractive index of a medium is modified by an electric field, is of central importance in nonlinear optics, laser technology, quantum optics and optical communications. In general, electro-optic coefficients are very weak and a medium with a giant electro-optic coefficient could have profound implications for precision electrometry and nonlinear optics at the single-photon level. Here we propose and demonstrate a giant d.c. electro-optic effect on the basis of polarizable (Rydberg) dark states. When a medium is prepared in a dark state consisting of a superposition of ground and Rydberg energy levels, it becomes transparent and acquires a refractive index that is dependent on the energy of the highly polarizable Rydberg state. We demonstrate phase modulation of the light field in the Rydberg-dark-state medium and measure an electro-optic coefficient that is more than six orders of magnitude larger than in usual Kerr media.
abstract_cn: 电光效应在非线性光学，激光技术，量子光学和光通信中具有极其重要的作用，其中介质的折射率会受到电场的影响。 通常，电光系数非常弱，具有大电光系数的介质可能对单光子级的精密电测定法和非线性光学有深远的影响。 在这里，我们提出并展示了一个巨大的直流电。 基于可极化（Rydberg）暗态的电光效应。 当将介质准备为由地面能级和Rydberg能级的叠加组成的暗态时，它会变得透明并获得依赖于高度可极化Rydberg态能量的折射率。 我们演示了里德堡-暗态介质中光场的相位调制，并测量了比通常的Kerr介质大六个数量级的电光系数。
